English:
In these COVID times I decided to choose a book about pandemics, but I decided to choose a 2011 book because I didn‚Äôt want to read anything that included the current pandemic. Information on Covid is not mature yet and I believe we need a few more years to have a more accurate account of the current pandemic.

I think I made a good choice because the author of the book, a physician at Hospital Oswaldo Cruz in S√£o Paulo, did an excellent job. The book is rich in bibliographic references and to some extent prophetic. He cites, for example, Brazil‚Äôs vulnerability to the Zika virus and chikungunya, which would arrive 3, 4 years after the publication. Even COVID is ‚Äúpredicted‚Äù when the book mentions that the next SARS pandemic would have its origins in bats. There is also a very good chapter on the ongoing struggle between antibiotics and bacteria.

A small negative is that since there is a lot of similarity between the behavior of different viruses and bacteria, the reading can become a little repetitive but that does not affect the overall quality of the work.
